entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 10:09AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RESUSPENDED ASH FROM KATMAI-NOVARUPTA EXPECTED OVER KODIAK ISLAND TONIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... Strong northwesterly winds (up to 40 mph) will develop this afternoon and persist through late Wednesday night. There is a high chance (75-85%) that these winds will resuspend ash from the 1912 Katmai- Novarupta eruption. The villages of Karluk, Akhiok
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kodiak Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 4:58AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: Low pressure will move into the Gulf of Alaska Tuesday morning, bringing widespread heavy rain along with strong winds through Thursday. Confidence is high on strong gusts greater than 40 mph along with widespread rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches across the region. Strong winds from this storm combined with saturated soils will also bring concerns for tree falls, mainly along river
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 3:58AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Wednesday Night Through Friday... Elevated surf is expected along the western Arctic coast from near Point Hope to Wainwright. North to northwesterly winds will increase on Wednesday to 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal areas. Winds will gradually decrease Friday. Wave action may cause minor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 3:58AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Blowing Snow This Afternoon and Tonight... Gusty east winds of 20 to 30 mph this morning will shift to the west this afternoon and increase to 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph. The combination of gusty winds and periods of snow will lead to areas of blowing snow through tonight. Visibility may be reduced to less than a mile at times this evening and tonight.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 3:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Wednesday Through Friday... Elevated surf is expected along the Chukchi Sea coast, including Kotzebue Sound and north-facing coasts of the Seward Peninsula. entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Noatak Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref
